1_1Ey4hYTcoTAGEbZM7UuMTNr24SH4LySwrP.body: Really, really hard. Copper lines are expensive, and at least in the US plenty of states have laws against the creation of municipal internet service.

Mesh networks are supposed to work well for city-wide networks. I live in a rural area, there's no feasible way to mesh with neighbors. Even with a city-wide mesh network I would need lines between my 7,000 person city and the next.
